ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to write different styles of creative nonfiction including personal narratives, writing about a place, satire, and cultural critiques. I improved my writing style and incorporated methods from essays we read in class to into my own writing.
Learned to appreciate creative nonfiction and write creative nonfiction. Exposure to great authors.
I learned to better express myself. This course made my transition from the greek to the american academic system smoother.
I became a much stronger writer. I now have a much better appreciation for the writing process and what good writing looks like.
How to write effectively about myself and my opinions, captivate an audience and utilize extended metaphors to convey an overarching message.
How to write creatively, and in various different styles such as humour essays

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: strengths: types of essays we read, engaging discussions, interesting writing assignments, small class size lends itself to individualized teaching, helpful feedback; weaknesses: as soon as you turn in a final draft you pretty much have to start the next essay

Strengths: Incredible experience because there were only 8 students and one very dedicated professor, had great class discussions, meetings on essays, and meaningful essay prompts.
Weaknesses: None

Strengths: becoming a stronger writer. My professor was always willing to help.

Weaknesses: the pieces we read could have been better selected.

I love the discussion based classroom structure and a majority of the readings were very interesting and applicable to my own writing. Another major strength of the class is the small size so that everyone has a chance to workshop their writings. Some of the readings were long and convoluted and it was hard to follow along, especially when there wasn't a lot of context surrounding work. Overall a great class!
Not too much reading, easy to engage in class, lots of feedback given

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It's a fun way to get a writing credit and read cool essays. The essay assignments are interesting and there is a lot of flexibility with the topics you can write about.
Absolutely, without hesitation. The professor was phenomenal; she was helpful, insightful, kind, and patient. Best English class taken at Yale.
I would recommend this course to other students. If you are passionate about writing or simply want to get better at it this course will help a lot.

Yes! This class is a great way to improve on your writing skills and learn how to read other essays for analysis and improvements. The discussion in the class also really helps vocalize your ideas in an effective way.
